code:
on readFileContents(filePath)
	tell application "Finder"
		set fileAlias to POSIX file filePath as alias
	end tell
	set fileContents to ""
	try
		set fileID to open for access fileAlias
		set fileContents to read fileID
		close access fileID
	on error
		try
			close access fileID
		end try
		error "Unable to read the file."
	end try
	return fileContents
end readFileContents
summary: This function reads and returns the contents of a file specified by the given file path in AppleScript.

on readFile(filePath)
	tell application "Finder"
		set fileRef to POSIX file filePath as alias
	end tell
	
	set fileContents to ""
	try
		set fileReference to open for access fileRef
		set fileContents to read fileReference
		close access fileReference
	on error errMsg
		try
			close access fileReference
		end try
		display dialog "Error reading file: " & errMsg
	end try
	
	return fileContents
end readFile
summary: Reads and returns the contents of a file at a specified file path, handling any errors that occur during the process.

code:
on writeTextToFile(filePath, textContent)
    set fileRef to open for access POSIX file filePath with write permission
    try
        set eof of fileRef to 0
        write textContent to fileRef starting at eof
    on error errMsg number errNum
        display dialog "Error: " & errMsg & " (" & errNum & ")"
    end try
    close access fileRef
end writeTextToFile
summary: Writes specified text content to a file at the given file path, overwriting existing content.

code:
on writeTextToFile(theText, theFilePath)
    set theFile to POSIX file theFilePath as text
    try
        open for access file theFile with write permission
        set eof of file theFile to 0
        write theText to file theFile starting at eof
        close access file theFile
    on error
        try
            close access file theFile
        end try
    end try
end writeTextToFile
summary: Writes a given text string to a specified file, overwriting any existing content.

	end tell

	tell application "Finder"
		set fileAlias to POSIX file filePath as alias
	end tell
	
	set fileContents to ""
	try
		set fileID to open for access fileAlias
		set fileContents to read fileID
		close access fileID

		close access fileID

	end try
	
	return fileContents

on readFromFile(filePath)
    try
        set fileRef to open for access file (filePath as text) with read permission
        set fileContents to read fileRef
        close access fileRef
        return fileContents
    on error
        try
            close access fileRef
        end try
        return "Error reading file."
    end try
end readFromFile

on readFileContents(filePath)
    set fileReference to POSIX file filePath as alias
    set fileContents to ""
    try
        set fileID to open for access fileReference
        set fileContents to read fileID as «class utf8»
        close access fileID
    on error errMsg number errNum
        if errNum is not -128 then
            try
                close access fileReference
            end try
        end if
        display dialog "Error: " & errMsg
    end try
    return fileContents
end readFileContents

		set fileRef to open for access file filePath with write permission
		try
			write textToWrite to fileRef
		on error errMsg number errNum
			close access fileRef
			display dialog "Error writing to file: " & errMsg
			return false
		end try
		close access fileRef
		return true
	end tell
end writeToFile
summary: Writes a given text string to a specified file, displaying an error dialog if the operation fails.

on readTextFile(filePath)
	try
		set fileRef to open for access file filePath
		set fileContents to read fileRef as «class utf8»
		close access fileRef
		return fileContents
	on error
		try
			close access file filePath
		end try
		return "Error reading file."
	end try
end readTextFile

	end tell
	
	if fileExists then
		set openFile to open for access (POSIX file theFilePath as text) with write permission
		set eof of openFile to 0
	else
		set openFile to open for access (POSIX file theFilePath as text) with write permission
	end if
	
	write theText to openFile starting at eof
	close access openFile
end writeTextToFile

on writeToTextFile(filePath, textToWrite)
	tell application "Finder"
		set targetFile to POSIX file filePath as alias
		set fileRef to open for access targetFile with write permission
		try
			set eof of fileRef to 0
			write textToWrite to fileRef starting at eof
		on error errMsg number errNum
			close access fileRef
			error "Error writing to file: " & errMsg number errNum
		end try
		close access fileRef
	end tell
end writeToTextFile

code:
```applescript
on readFileContents(filePath)
	tell application "Finder"
		set fileRef to POSIX file filePath as alias
		if exists fileRef then
			try
				set fileHandle to open for access fileRef
				set fileContent to read fileHandle as «class utf8»
				close access fileHandle
				return fileContent
			on error errMsg number errNum
				try
					close access fileHandle
				end try
				return "Error: " & errMsg
			end try
		else
			return "Error: File does not exist."
		end if
	end tell
end readFileContents
```

		set fileRef to open for access (POSIX file theFilePath as string) with write permission
		try
			set eof of fileRef to 0
			write theText to fileRef starting at eof
		on error errMsg number errNum
			close access fileRef
			error errMsg number errNum
		end try
		close access fileRef
	end tell
end writeTextToFile
summary: Writes a given text to a specified file, overwriting its existing contents if any.

		set fileReference to POSIX file filePath as alias
	end tell
	set fileContents to ""
	try
		open for access fileReference
		set fileContents to read fileReference
		close access fileReference
	on error
		try
			close access fileReference
		end try
		display dialog "An error occurred while reading the file."
	end try
	return fileContents
end readFileContents

on writeToFile(filePath, content)
    set fileDescriptor to open for access file filePath with write permission
    try
        set eof fileDescriptor to 0
        write content to fileDescriptor
    on error errMsg
        display dialog "Error writing to file: " & errMsg
    end try
    close access fileDescriptor
end writeToFile

on readFile(filePath)
    try
        set fileRef to open for access file filePath
        set fileContents to read fileRef as «class utf8»
        close access fileRef
        return fileContents
    on error errMsg number errNum
        if errNum is -49 then
            return "Error: File not found."
        else
            return "Error: " & errMsg
        end if
    end try
end readFile

on readFileContents(filePath)
    set fileContents to ""
    try
        set fileReference to open for access file filePath
        set fileContents to read fileReference
        close access fileReference
    on error errMsg number errNum
        if errNum is not -49 then
            close access filePath
        end if
        error errMsg number errNum
    end try
    return fileContents
end readFileContents
